seo.title: FAQ | SustainSage
seo.description: Clear answers about coaching scope, logistics, ethics and fit with SustainSage.

hero.title: Honest answers to help you decide if coaching fits.
hero.body: Each response follows ICF coaching ethics: clear scope, consent-based work and respect for your pace. If you need more context, explore our approach or reach out directly.

items.question: Is coaching right for me or do I need therapy?
items.answer: Coaching explores goals, systems and experiments. If you are processing trauma, acute mental health needs or require diagnosis, a licensed therapist is the right partner. We can pause and refer you to clinical support at any point.

items.question: What if I don’t have a clear goal yet?
items.answer: That’s common. We begin with what feels most alive and co-create a working focus in session. ICF ethics require us to keep you in charge of the agenda, so we check clarity and consent regularly.

items.question: Can we talk about visas, immigration or legal concerns?
items.answer: We can explore the leadership and emotional impact of those processes, and map questions for your legal advisors. I do not provide legal or immigration advice and will flag when a specialist is needed.

links.label: Support for newcomers to the UK

items.question: How do payments and cancellations work?
items.answer: Packages are invoiced upfront or in two parts and payable by bank transfer. You can reschedule with 24 hours’ notice; late cancellations count as a session so we protect time for all clients.

items.question: Where and how do sessions happen?
items.answer: Sessions run on Zoom unless you request an accessible alternative. I send a shared notes doc so you can track actions and agreements without juggling extra tools.

items.question: Do you work with employers or sponsors?
items.answer: Yes. We align expectations in a three-way agreement that keeps coaching goals client-led. Sponsors receive high-level progress updates only with your consent and no session detail is shared.

items.question: How confidential is it?
items.answer: I follow the ICF Code of Ethics and UK data law. Sessions stay confidential except where there’s risk of harm or legal duty to disclose. We review how your information is stored before we begin.

items.question: How do you create safety across cultures and languages?
items.answer: We set shared agreements on pace, language switching and boundaries. You choose the terms for feedback and challenge, and I signal limits when something sits outside coaching scope.

items.question: Do you keep notes on our sessions?
items.answer: I keep minimal, encrypted notes focused on goals and actions. You can review or ask me to delete them at any time, except where legal record keeping is required.

items.question: What if I feel this isn’t working for me?
items.answer: Please say so. We will debrief what you need, adjust structure or refer you elsewhere. Ending coaching is always your choice and we close with clear next steps.

items.question: How soon will I see change?
items.answer: Most clients notice clarity after two to three sessions as experiments build. Coaching supports your practice between sessions, so results rely on the actions you choose to take.

items.question: Can I combine coaching with other support?
items.answer: Absolutely. Many clients pair coaching with therapy, supervision or peer circles. We keep coordination transparent and adapt homework so it complements your other care.

cta.title: Still unsure?
cta.body: Share your context and we’ll confirm whether coaching, a referral or another resource will serve you best. Your clarity matters more than filling a slot.
